content: Shopping Credit Card Asked by AnonymousAsked on 23 May 2019I'm a noob at this, but which credit card is the best for foodie? - I like to eat out at least 2 times a week. Which cc can give the best rebates/ points? TIA!?I have not owned any credit card currently, looking for the best one to apply!3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Dexter Tiah, Founder at Whatcard.sgLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 20 Jun 2019Depending on whether you can hit the minimum spending of the credit card, you can get from 1.5% (generic spend cashback) to 10% (boc family card, cimb platinum) in cashback. Ocbc titanium reward has the highest miles rewards at 4mpd.However, theres a lot of terms and conditions with these cards, so to simplify all these research, i suggest (shameless plug here) that you consider using www.whatcard.sg right before you transact at your merchant, just to double check you know?0 comments0

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 24 May 2019Hey! For me personally, I'm a user of the OCBC365 Credit card.It offers between 3% (weekend) to 6% (weekday) cashback for the dining portion itself.So I suggest that this is a really fuss free kind of card for people like you which gives you cash rebates.I think you should use cashback cards vs miles cards for pure beginners as it's alot easier to understand for beginners.Hope this helps! Here's one that one of our writers wrote about: https://blog.seedly.sg/best-cashback-credit-cards/UPDATE: CIMB Visa signature changed their policy recently.0 comments0

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 23 May 2019Check out and apply at Singsaver or Gobear to get extra free gifts given by the bank to them and they share with applicants for applying via them:  https://www.singsaver.com.sg/credit-card/dining/results  https://www.gobear.com/sg/credit-card/dining?sort=coverageScore-Desc0 comments0
